thread.title: Judge should deny Dani Mathers request to avoid jail: Attorney
thread.title_full: Judge should deny Dani Mathers request to avoid jail: Attorney - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Judge should deny Dani Mathers request to avoid jail: Attorney
text:
Prosecutors aren't playing around when it comes to Dani Mathers' naked gym photo incident.
The L.A. City Attorney asked a judge to deny the ex Playboy Playmate's request to avoid jail time by undergoing counseling and anti-bullying courses, noting that she never apologized to the 71-year-old victim, TMZ reports .
The City Attorney did not reveal if he would demand jail time, according to the gossip site, but TMZ reports he scoffed at her attempt for mercy.
Mathers, 29, is facing up to six months in jail for invasion of privacy after she Snapchatted a picture of a naked woman in a gym locker room with the caption "If I can't unsee this then you can't either."
Playboy Playmate Dani Mathers could face jail time for gym photo 
The model's lawyer Tom Mesereau said its a "pathetic attempt" by the City Attorney and a waste of taxpayer money.
Dani Mathers posted this photo of herself mocking a naked woman at her gym on Snapchat on July 14, 2016. (DANI MATTHEWS VIA SNAPCHAT) Although she never apologized to the victim, before the 71-year-old woman came forward, Mathers shared a public apology.
"There is no excuse," Mathers wrote on Twitter. "I understand fully the magnitude of this post that I have hurt a lot of people, women. Body shaming is not okay ... and not something to joke about."
Mathers pleaded not guilty in November to a misdemeanor count of invasion of privacy.
